##### I'm in my last year pursuing a Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Statistics and Data Science and a minor in [Spatial Studies](http://spatial.ucsb.edu/academic-minor/) at the University of California at Santa Barbara (UCSB).  

***

Last summer, I took an R based GIS course (Geography 176A - Intro to Geographic Information Systems and Science). 

Assignments included: 

- working with raw data to create updating tables and plots that breakdown Covid-19 case data

- extracting US census data  to analyze the impacted populations at the US border zone 

- completing a dam analysis to examine dam patterns in the US

- implementing remote sensing based flood analysis

- constructing a partial FIM library

More info can be found [here](https://catherinerauch.github.io/geog176A.html#previous-work).


I am looking forward to using the skills learned in this class, including collecting and cleaning raw data, vector/raster data manipulation, creating/joining spatial data and objects, and geographical focused visualizations and tables, to create more spatial projects.
